runs.comm: Bond starts off with a bouncer, 136kmh, a grunt as he lets that one fly, Dilshan loves the hook and he goes for it, misses
low full toss outside off,  outside edge takes it past first slip and races to the third man boundary
short and wide, Dilshan stands tall and slams it over the cover, one bounce and over the ropes
Dilshan makes it three in a row, length ball this time, threads it on the up between extra cover and mid-off, what a first over this has been
Dilshan is giving Bond no respect, plants his foot down the ground, and slams it on the up over extra cover for another boundary
this is fantastic cricket, Bond hits back with a slower ball that seams into Dilshan, who swings at it but misses
length ball outside off, Jayasuriya looks to drive but gets an inside edge towards backward point to get off the mark
Dilshan's on fire here, brings out the Dilscoop, times it perfectly and it sails over the keeper for a boundary, what a brave shot that is
Dilshan was  going for the big heave but checked his shot at the last moment, bunts it towards mid-on for a single
back of a length and heading for Jayasuriya ribs, the batsman defends off the back foot
Mills gets the breakthrough, Jayasuriya was looking to play that short-arm pull of his, but gets a top edge towards Shane Bond at short fine leg
angling into the pads, Dilshan guides it towards midwicket, and the batsmen zip through for two
lovely stroke from Jayawardene, a short ball just outside off, Jayawardene stands tall and cuts that over point, the fielder has to put the dive in at the boundary to cut that off
driven firmly off the front foot to extra cover
back of a length outside off, Dilshan jabs it towards cover and the batsmen take a quick single
full and well outside off, Jayawardene swings at it and misses
good ball from Bond, heading for offstump, Jayawardene pushes it towards mid-off
good comeback from Bond, extra bounce on that delivery, Jayawardene looked to glide it towards backward point, but is beaten by the bounce
New Zealand need to get rid of Dilshan soon, or this match is going to be over, short ball from Mills is dismissed over square leg, just clear the ropes
on the pads this time, tickled down to fine leg for a couple
Smash! Dilshan is on the rampage, length ball, Dilshan gets under it and clobbers it over mid-on
clever change from Mills, slow and full outside off, Dilshan drives it down to mid-off for a single
back of a length and outside off, chopped towards backward point, too firmly for a single
length ball angling down the leg side, Jayawardene wanted to clip that to the leg side but is rapped on the pads

full and outside off, Dilshan squeezes it towards backward point, a great diving stop from Ryder, he follows that  up with a direct hit to the striker's end, and that's the end of Jayawardene. Superb fielding from Ryder
crisply driven from Sangakkara, McCullum shies at the stump,s and Jacob Orma has to put in a full-length dive to stop that

another good-looking drive from Sangakkara through the covers, the rain has made the outfield a bit slippery, Guptill loses his footing as he bends to pick up the ball, he tosses it McCullum, who throws it back to the keeper
full and wide, Dilshan throws his bat at it, and that's cracking square drive all along the ground
Dilshan shows us he's not all about power, fullish ball on the middle, bends and paddle sweeps t over short fine leg for another boundary
well outside off stump, very full as well, Dilshan had already decided to play it to fine leg irrespective of where the ball was, and he misses
Sangakkara dabs it towards backward point off the back foot
full, just outside off, Dilshan waltzes down the pitch and drives it past cover, there's a sweeper cover to cut that off
Sangakkara joins the party, he advances down the pitch and lofts it past mid-on for a boundary
a bit of an ugly heave from Sangakkara, short and wide, and he mows it towadrs wide mid-on
low full toss just outside off, punched to mid-on by Sangakkara
not much going New Zealand's way here, an inside edge from Sangakkara runs past the keeper, making short fine leg run across and field
starts with an arm ball, driven towards cover
tossed up this time, played with soft hands towards point by Dilshan
Sangakkara shows the full face of the bat as he drives to long-on, the batsmen waddle through for a single
Dilshan reaches his 50 off 23 balls, by chopping the ball towards backward point
Sangakkara is undone by Vettori, the batsman chips it off the backfoot straight to McCullum at short midwicket, New Zealand are still in it
gets on the backfoot and swings it hard, a stunning stop from McCullum at short midwicket denies Rupasinghe his first international runs
full ball just outside off, Dilshan comes down the ground and drives it through covers for a boundary, no stopping this man
swung away to deep fine leg for a single this time
struck on the pads, that was sliding down leg, the ball rolls towards square leg
overpitched on middle and leg, whipped  to deep midwicket, Dilshan could have been struggling to make his ground for the second, but the throw was very wide
full ball, driven back to the bowler
that's the wicket that New Zealand needed, Dilshan reaches out for a full ball outside off, ends up chipping the ball to Ryder at backward point, a great, low diving catch from Ryder
on the pads, defended towards short midwicket
again watchfully defended off the front foot
length ball, Kapugedera takes a couple of paces down the track and drives the ball towards long-on
on the pads, turned away to square leg for a single by Rupasinghe
a nicely-paced sweep from Kapugedera, the fielder had to race across to his left from backward square leg to stop that one
comes down the pitch and taps it back to the bowler
length ball angling into offstump, defended off the back foot
short ball, Rupasinghe was onto it in a flash, pulls it well in front of square for a boundary, off the front foot as well
inside-edged onto his pads this time, the batsmen sprint through for a single
back of a length ball outside off, an attempted pull, goes off the toe end of the bat towards mid-on
defended off the front foot by Kapugedera
Butler has struck, that was a pathetic shot from Kapugedera, a swipe across the line, he misses and the ball crashes into off and middle
gets forward and blocks it towards short midwicket
glances it towards short fine leg, no run
clipped off the back foot towards short midwicket
great over from Vettori, a quicker one is defended to the off side
full and on the pads, turned towards fine leg
flighted delivery, defends off the back foot to the leg side, Vettori has to run across to field that one

two near run-outs in that ball, Sri Lanka survive though, pushed to cover and the batsman set off for a run, McCullum shies at the keeper's stumps, misses or else Rupasinghe was gone, then there was an attempt at the non-strikers end, where again Rupasinghe would have been caught short, throw was wide there as well
short ball, pulled to fine leg for a single
Rupasinghe pulls nicely, he seems to like that shot. should have been two at most, but Guptill takes his eyes off the ball as he tries to pick it up, the misfield gives away an extra run
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, defended back down the pitch
short of a length again, well outside off, driven to mid-on, Mathews calls for a single straightaway and the batsmen get it comfortably
a length ball is wristily worked down to long-on for a single
Rupasinghe bends his knees as he slashes a short of length ball towards point
punched firmly off the front foot to mid-off, Rupasinghe wants the single but Mathews sends him back
another front-foot drive, McCullum dives at short cover to take the pace off the ball, which dribbles to mid-off
slightly overpitched from Bond, keeping the batsmen quiet here, this one is blocked back by the batsman
nearly a yorker, just outside off, punched towards mid-on for a single
slow, short of length delivery to start, played with soft hands towatrds mid-on, the batsmen pinch a tight single
whipped from outside off towards midwicket, a hint of Duminy about Rupasinghe, particularly in his leg side play
Mathews gets his front foot well outside off stump, and picks up the ball and sweeps it over short fine leg for a boundary, that brings up the 100
mishit this time, unluckily for New Zealand, it lands safely, Mathews wanted to flick that one but edges it straight over the bowler's head
full outside off, Mathews squeezes it to backward point and sets off for a single, sent back and he has to scramble to make his ground
Mathews does a repeat of the shop that fetched him four earlier this over, again a cheeky sweep over short fine leg gets him four runs
outside off, goes for the sweep and misses
shouts of 'Catch' as Rupasinghe sweeps in the direction of Broom at deep midwicket, lands short of the fielder though
quicker delivery there, 96kmh, 20kmh faster than the previous one, outside edge flies past the keeper
driven firmly to long-off, a misfield by Oram but there's no extra run
wanted to play it to leg, gets a leading edge towards cover
last ball of Vettori's spell and he strikes, Rupasinghe is trapped lbw, itching on off, Rupasinghe wanted to turn it to leg, misses and is struck in front of off, no doubt about that one
driven firmly to extra cover for a single
length ball outside off, gets an outside edge towards third man
short ball on middle and leg, pulled towards deep fine leg
back of a length ball on offstump, Kulasekara plays it wristily towards mid-on
Mathews comes down the track and lashes it through cover, Guptill at sweeper cover does the fielding
tapped with soft hands towards cover, McCullum races across to field
pushed off the front foot towards cover, McCullum shies at the striker's end, misses and concedes an overthrow
Mathews gets on the front foot and whips it stylishly towards Bond at long-on, good work from Bond keeps the batsmen to a single
Kulasekara gets air borne as he upper cuts a short ball, placement is great, timing isn't, Mathews races back for the third
outside edge lands just short of short third man, the batsmen sprint through for a single
slightly overpitced, well outside off, Kulasekara gets forward and drives through cover
Oram gets rid of Mathews, who chips an innocuous delivery back to the bowler, huge wicket that, Mathews, Sri Lanka's last remaining recognised batsman, has just perished to a full toss
the batsman slaps that over the infield towards sweeper cover, land just a few yards short of the fielder
slow, short ball outside off, Bandra wanted to dab that to third man but doesn't connect
back of a length, angling into Bandara, who chops it towards backward point, where Ryder (who has been exceptional in the field so far) misfields

it was New Zealand's fielding that kept them in the game when Dilshan was going berserk, now it's the fielding that's letting them down, another misfield, this time at long-on, giving away an extra run
Bandara hammers that one to mid-off, Vettori fields and a direct hit would have ended Bandara's stay
pegs away at a back of a length, on middle stump, Kulasekara turns it towards midwicket, and gets a tight single, direct hit would have made things interesting
length ball outside off, driven crisply to long-off, hit too firmly to get a double
Bond goes for the yorker, it's a touch shorter than he wanted, the batsman squeezes it to mid-off
high full toss, punched back towards the bowler, who gets a hand to it but can't stop the batsmen from taking a single
a dot ball, precious for New Zealand, Bandara swipes that towards short midwicket
another dot ball, only three of the over do far, slower ball from Bond, great stuff, Bandara swings at it and misses
high full toss, another heave from Bandara sends the ball towards mid-off, a single to retain the strike, wonderful over from Bond

a great jumping catch from McCullum at long-off silences the crowd, a low full toss from Oram, Bandara lofts it straight at long-on, that's another dot ball, McCullum amde plenty of ground to his right before taking that one
Oram's on a hat-trick now, Kulaskeara holes out to long-on, another low full toss, Kulasekara's shot finds Broom, who has an easier catch than McCullum last ball
a yorker on offstump, Malinga gets it away to mid-off for a single
a leg bye, full outside off stump, tried to sweep, is struck on the pads, and the ball rolls towards point
full and wide, Malinga gets under it and clobbers it towards sweeper cover, Nathan McCullum races across to his right to try complete a spectacular catch but can't hang on to it
New Zealand have won, wonderful comeback  by them, the last ball was full and wide again, Malinga drives it to long-off for a single, three-run victory for New Zealand
